data.description: Regular GSO block for constructing the basic structure of a Tech.

The GeoCorp Buzz Saw is mainly used for cutting trees in half. The Excavator is the next step up in the series. This tool is mainly used for cutting planets in half. Yes. That's right. A planet! Oh look! You can plug it in with a regular household plug too. You don't need one of those special power tool ones, that's handy.

The Component Factory takes lower resource types and works them into Component Chunks of various grades. The Component Factories range of outputs can be upgraded by attaching Component Dongle Blocks. In its vanilla state, it can produce Grade 1 Component Chunks.

The Crossfire is a fixed mid-range rifle that packs more of a punch than the Hail Fire, but has a slower rate of fire. It also needs to be aimed directly at the target to connect as it is not gimbal mounted.

data.block: Better Future Stream Wide Five Left Block
data.description: I bet you never thought you'd see the day when you had a Wide Five Left Streamlined Block to call your very own. Well good for you, you deserve it. Treat yourself.

The Repulsor Cannon is a ground-to-air anti-aircraft weapon that fires an electro-magnetic charge which generates a repulsion pulse when they collide with their target. These pulses cause low damage to the target, but have very high impulse force, which knock most flying Techs off-course making it very difficult to continue flying once hit. This weapon can only be placed in an upright orientation.
The long range AKIRA railgun is a relatively new addition to the arsenal. Using high-powered electromagnets, this weapon will punch a hole in just about anything, no matter how far away they are.
An armour plate with a porthole in the side so that the people inside can see out.

data.block: Better Future Small Side Halo Wheel
data.description: Very similar to the Small Straight Halo wheel, but in a handy side mounting variant so that you can build your Tech how you want it.
The CLAW is a slimline plasma cutter with a medium range and moderate power.

The "Atlas" rotor is a heavy duty piece of kit. An extremely powerful engine drives this wide wing span rotor to generate extreme lift. It also converts any linear axis that it is aligned with into a throttle input. Use the Helicopter Control Scheme’s Lift controls to Ascend and Descend when a Rotor is vertically aligned. If aligned to other directions (Acceleration or Strafe), then Rotors will work with those controls instead.
This radar module will allow you to see nearby friends, enemies, missions and Trading Stations!

data.block: Better Future Left Medium Hover Flipper
data.description: The Hover Flippers are great versatile hover blocks. The internal hover ring will angle itself to give you some steering, but this block also has built in Adjustment Thrusters. Hover Tech Magazine said "If you only use one Hover Block this year, make it the Better Future Left Medium Hover Flipper." Although we recommend you use it in conjunction with the right variant too. It just works better that way.
Larger wheels with a bit more umpf!

data.block: Better Future Active Single Axis Gyro
data.description: This Active Single Axis Gyro applies torque to keep your Tech upright, but only along one axis. For example, if you want to make a motorcycle that won't fall over sideways, but is still able to pull dank wheelies, this is the gyro for you.
An entry level booster. Needs a fuel tank to run for long.
Continue work deep into the night with floodlights.

data.block: Better Future Medium Side Halo Wheel
data.description: A tough medium sized Halo Wheel with side mountings.

data.block: Better Future Streamline Extender Five Block
data.description: The biggest Streamlined Extender Block going. This is it, the Five! I'm in awe of it.
This little gizmo will add a speedo to the HUD. You can see how fast you're going now.
The entry level Adjustment Thruster. This will help you steer your ungrounded Techs with a bit more ease.
A block made out of compressed Luxian for ease of transportation. Produces 24 Luxian crystals when scrapped.
A block made out of compressed Celestian for ease of transportation. Produces 8 Celestian crystals when scrapped.
A block made out of compressed Erudian for ease of transportation. Produces 42 Erudian crystals when scrapped.
Use this on the back of your flyer to help it steer.
A sturdy metal wheel with gripping studs.
A block made out of compressed Celestian for ease of transportation. Produces 120 Celestian crystals when scrapped.
The "Bayonet" shotgun is a devastating short range projectile weapon. It also neatly integrates into the front of any Tech, leaving plenty of attach points for further building above.

The Cat Nine Flail Guard is a great defensive tool for clearing away any bits and bobs that get too close to your wheels when mining. They're also pretty handy for keeping any troublemaking Techs from attacking you from the sides or back.
This streamlined large dinosaur head shaped block helps to neaten up the lines of your Venture Tech and also trades fewer Attach Points for a bit more armour.
This Better Future Scrapper consumes Better Future blocks and converts them back into resource chunks.
The Avalanche Launcher fires short range lock-on missiles. As long as you're in range, these missiles will hit their mark.
The armoured Warhorse. These wheels are tougher and faster than anything GeoCorp make in this size. Sure they can't carry as much, but they're built for combat, not for lugging junk around.

An extra large armoured slope block. Part of the Fort armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
An articulated drill grinder with very dense crystal tips. It will angle up and down when activated, and hold position but grind on contact with a target.

The Zero Point Energy Gun fires a sticky energy projectile. When it hits a target, it will hold in place and the project a temporary gravity distortion bubble. Everything inside the bubble will experience zero gravity.
The Notch Armour Plate is tougher than the GSO and GeoCorp ones of a similar size, but it's also more expensive. It also includes an Attach Point on the outside to mount extra weapons to.
The Venture 5-Way Adjustment Thruster is a great block for attempting to control Techs in the air. It will enable tilting and rolling. It's also good for steering hover Techs.
A Better Future One Block. Yep, it's a One Block, I don't know what you were hoping to find here. You know it's a One Block, we know it's a One Block. It's a One Block.
This is a great tool for felling trees.
Much like the one block, this two block can stand up to a fair bit of punishment, but it's also heavier and more expensive to boot.

This SCU Storage Device can be used whilst on the move, it does not need to be anchored. It does take a little bit longer to pick things up and has a shorter range than the anchored one, but it's still pretty convenient.
High rate of fire. Low focus. High recoil. This thing is a beast.

A beefy off-road track built for speed over rough terrain. Not the toughest under fire and it wasn't made to carry a heavy burden, but it will get you through the trickiest inclines, at speed, with ease.

This curious block is the exact opposite of an Anti Gravity Engine. As the name suggests, it increases the effects of gravity on all blocks under its influence. It can be used to temporarily change the centre of gravity of a Tech. Just like an Anti Gravity Engine, it requires power to function.
A useful bracket system for versatility when building unusual Techs.
A block made out of compressed Fibron for ease of transportation. Produces 64 Fibron chunks when scrapped.
A great starter machine gun. High rate of fire. Poor accuracy.
A simple straight bumper section that spans two units. Part of a set of blocks that can be used to make strong bull bars, bumpers and rams.
This Block will add a Fuel Gauge to the HUD which will display how much fuel is stored on your Tech's fuel tanks.

A small armoured corner half block. Part of the Edge armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.

Large Venture wheels are strong and fast.

The Venture Springer Wheel is brought to you by hyper athlete and motor sports legend Florian Gamper. The renowned German Track and Field Champion said of the new all terrain wheel; 'the attention to detail that's gone into this design is impeccable'. The all seasons, wave riding captain added 'Venture really push their engineers to the limit to get optimal performance out of their wheels'. The self confessed day dream believer added 'getting stuck in the slow lane is for neo-broccoli boys, for real power, go with Venture'.
GeoCorp Fixed Anchor is a great start point for a base.
This is a moderately powerful laser front facing stud fixing.
A block made out of compressed Carbius for ease of transportation. Produces 8 Carbius bricks when scrapped.

An armoured half one block. Part of the Edge armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.

data.block: Better Future Stream Wide Four Right Block
data.description: The corresponding Wide Four Right Corner Streamlined Block. You asked for it, so we delivered it! Wait… you didn't ask for it? Oh, well… here it is anyway!
A middle range small Collector. Good armour but has a mid-level range and capacity.

data.block: Better Future Small Air Rig Extender
data.description: An extender section to modify the Small Air Rig.
A straight bumper section with no frills - one unit across. Part of a set of blocks that can be used to make strong bull bars, bumpers and rams.
A compact little fuel tank. Remember to bring lots of these if you want to use your boosters.

data.block: Better Future Small Straight Halo Wheel
data.description: With a beefier wide tyre, this Halo wheel is a bit more stable than the angled one.

A large armoured extender block. Part of the Wrap Armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
A block made out of compressed Titania for ease of transportation. Produces 8 Titania ingots when scrapped.

The HG1 Cannon Turret incorporates a compact 16 pound oscillating cannon with auto-loading capabilities.

Dr N. Greyswandir (D.Eng.), the controversial inventor of the "Holey-Moley Hunter-Killer Mole-Mower" has today unveiled his newest weapon, the HG1 Cannon Turret commissioned by Hawkeye PMC to rival the GSO's, Megaton Cannon. The new HG1 is a devastating cannon, which can hit a target with a high explosive shell at very long range. Greyswandir came out of retirement to lead the HG1 project specifically to out-do his long-time professional rival Dr Glutton (inventor of the Megaton Cannon). Speaking of Glutton, Greyswandir said, "He was barking mad to think that he could build a better cannon. He should come work for me, we need a dogsbody to do some grunt work around here.
This is a great elbow shaped block. Perfect to build around a corner. Nice and light, but fairly durable too.
Very fast racing wheels with slick tyres and hard suspension. These are not off-road tyres so they lack friction on sand and pebbles, but they are some of the fastest wheels around.
A small power cell that can be recharged by a generator. Use this to power shields.
This manufacturing block can be attached to any conveyor to let the held chunk be picked off and dropped onto the floor.

This clever little computer will help you stay in one place when you stop driving most types of ungrounded Techs (hovercraft, helicopters and anti-gravity craft, not so much for planes though). When you stop driving, this computer will take over and steer your Hover Pads, Adjustment Thrusters and Propellers to try to keep you in one place and stop you from drifting around out of control.

A large Outside Corner Bumper with 2 attach points at either end and an added bracket with an additional 2 attach aoints. Part of a set of blocks that can be used to make strong bull bars, bumpers and rams.
This streamlined hooked beak shaped corner block helps to neaten up the lines of your Venture Tech and also trades fewer Attach Points for a bit more armour.
A block made out of compressed Erudian for ease of transportation. Produces 24 Erudian crystals when scrapped.
This Medium Armour Plate is tougher than the GSO one, but it's also more expensive and heavier.

The Anchored Maze SCU has a fair pick-up range and power-up time, but its real stand out feature is in the armour department. Like all SCU devices, it will store loose blocks in another dimension and make them available in your inventory for use later.
A reliable Adjustment Thruster unit. Perfect for steering ungrounded Techs through the air. It has a fair amount of armour.
A juggernaught booster jet. Drinks fuel and blasts off.
Connect this Filter to a Conveyor loop. Imprint it with an item by dragging the item on top of it. Once imprinted it will filter that item out from the rest.

A pair of split corner sloping armour plates. Part of the Spike armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
A small Block Magnet that will pick-up and hold any nearby loose blocks.
A useful bracket system for versatility when building unusual Techs.
This battery launches six micro-missiles into a swarming cluster that will home-in on any nearby targets. Fly my pretties! Fly!
A sturdy front mounted propeller.
A block made out of compressed Ignian for ease of transportation. Produces 120 Ignian crystals when scrapped.

data.block: Better Future Medium Long Halo Wheel
data.description: The Medium Halo wheels are fast, responsive and look awesomely futuristic.
A basic digger scoop claw. Your entry level flipper unit.
Standard cab module from the Galactic Survey Organisation.
Small Venture wheels still leave everyone else in the dust.
A complete bumper section with straight middles and corners at each end spanning 6 units across. Part of a set of blocks that can be used to make strong bull bars, bumpers and rams.
You get the idea by now right? This is used for sloping mid sections that are Four Blocks long.

data.block: Better Future Stream Corner Four Block
data.description: Put this on the end of your sloping Streamlined Four Block sections to make them look all neat and tidy.
A Venture remote charger that can transfer stored energy from one Tech to any other allied one with a battery. Short range, fast arc speed and low arc power.
This block is heavy duty, strong and resilient. It's also a bit more expensive than that GSO rubbish.
This is pretty much the longest GSO block around.
These bright orange light emitting diodes are an excellent and efficient choice for lighting your Tech on night adventures.
This extra large continuous track has a massive carry capacity and excellent offroad grip. It's not very fast though.

This is the biggest wheel available anywhere. It's stupidly big. Bigger than a really big thing. When people see these wheels, they can't help but exclaim "Gosh, that's a really big wheel." They are big.
This Streamlined Two Block is good for two long sloping sections. Works well with the Streamlined Corner Two Block.

Standard issue GSO collector for transporting up to 5 resources to the desired destination.

After a heady night of celebratory space drinking (similar to high altitude drinking), cosmonaut - Erasmus Guy, woke up in an EVA suit suspended in the holding beam of his trusty thimble pad. Were it not for the pad he would have floated away into open space. He now happily warns any new cadets about the unique pleasures of waking up upside-down wearing a suit filled with chunder in a zero-g holding beam.
The Mobile Delivery Cannon can sell chunks whilst on the move on a mobile Tech, making it much easier to earn money.
A very powerful persistent beam Laser Cannon that can aim in a full 360 degree circle. This weapon will continuously burn away at its target with pin point focus.
A U shaped bracket. A lightweight alternative to including a whole block. Pretty strong too!
A robust fuel tank with armour plating. This one will take a few knocks, but it also weighs a fair bit too.
A block made out of compressed Fibron for ease of transportation. Produces 42 Fibron bricks when scrapped.
A block made out of compressed Olastic for ease of transportation. Produces 24 Olastic bricks when scrapped.
This block adds a Speedometer element to your HUD. Speedometers tell you how fast you are travelling.
This Component Dongle can be attached to a Component Factory to allow it to produce Exotic Component Chunks.
A medium size, very powerful rotor. Remember to use a control scheme that has lift controls to operate a vertically aligned rotor.
The Better Future eCab is the ultimate in Cab only freedom. It hovers, it moves around (sort of), it even has laser guns! Pew! pew! pew! Take that other Corporations!

A standard conveyor. It moves things around any circuit you create.

Professor Le Rouge (P.A.N. da) was the original inventor of the conveyor technology for the Nosey Construction Company used in many automated off-world strip mining operations. After seeing the mass deforestation that his creations had indirectly enabled, he was distraught. In that moment he renounced his earlier career. He now spends all his time as an eco activist - spreading awareness of the plight of the red pandas (for which he has a particular love) that have been displaced by the relentless destruction of off-world mining programs.

The Venture 2-Way Adjustment Thruster is a great block for adding precision controls to a hover or flying Tech in a single axis only. Unlike the 5-way version, this block lets you limit the exact direction of force along one axis.
Attach this generator to a thermal vent to generate free electricity. Lookout for smoker rocks and destroy them to reveal thermal vents.
Attach this block to a manufacturing base to let you slow down or speed up its rate of production.

A large Anti-gravity Engine. It has a wider radius of effect and it's more powerful, reducing affected blocks all the way to zero gravity. But it does drain more power for each block that it has an effect on.

The GSO Combat Shotgun is just the tool for when things get up close and personal. This boomstick packs a real punch, dealing scattershot damage and knock back to close quarters targets. Just don't expect it to do too much over a longer range.

The ‘PX’ is a continuous track tread set built with kevlar bi-weave for strength, flexibility and grip. Unlike steel tread tracks, with links that often need manual repair, this tread has a built-in molten fabric repair unit that top up worn sections of tread whilst in motion. The PX is a smaller more versatile track compared with the larger M4 and the giant TT12.
The Resource Receiver takes new chunks into a base, ready to circulate them.
Use the Payload Terminal to purchase Better Future blocks.
A huge Collector that can gather up a lot of resource chunks.
This is a very big Block. Possibly the biggest one. But that's been said before about other ones, so let's not get into that again. Anyway, this is a big one!

data.block: GeoCorp Active All Axis Heavy Gyro
data.description: A really heavy duty gyroscope powerful enough to correct a tilt on very large Techs. This gyro is "active", meaning it will apply torque to force your Tech back to an upright position. And it's also "all axis", meaning it works in all three rotational directions.

A small explosive bolt with 2 attach points. This block is a single use item. When attached to a Tech, it will self destruct when you trigger it. This allows you to build multiple Techs within Techs to be converted on the fly without damaging the blocks.

A lightweight, fast firing heavy armament. This twin barrel cannon can outpace a Megaton in rate of fire and range, although it is let down slightly in the damage and blast radius departments. Still a solid bit of kit.
An angled half block section which is specially hardened to withstand great force and angled to deflect most incoming strikes.
A long range GeoCorp Resource Receiver, this will pick-up lots of chunks very quickly.
A block made out of compressed Carbius for ease of transportation. Produces 64 Carbius bricks when scrapped.
A large, powerful, responsive wing that has built-in gimbals so that the whole thing acts as a flap. These provide serious amounts of lift.

A heavy mining plasma cutter tool. This will torch any substance in a matter of seconds.

The Plasma Cutter, mining grade energy tool was developed by a molecular biologist, Dr. Chrii Von Vieh of the Germland Institute in Scotmany. Dr.Chrii's other notable achievements include the discovery of an anthrax antidote, the so called, Black Lipid Bilayer- technique. His original intent for what became the Plasma Cutter was to build a beam tool that could repair liver cells damaged by the Chriillings Virus (which he also first identified). However, he got a few wires crossed and instead created an incredibly powerful and destructive energy weapon. Dr.Chrii's comments on record about his beam tool were "Meh, I guess that's close enough."
An angled long half block section which is specially hardened to withstand great force and angled to deflect most incoming strikes.
A half block inside corner. To make neat corner transitions.

data.block: Better Future Stream Internal Corner Block
data.description: A Streamlined internal corner One Block. Perfect for sloping internal corner sections. Joins up well with the Streamlined Corner One Block.
A block made out of compressed Plumbia for ease of transportation. Produces 8 Plumbia ingots when scrapped.
A small Generator. It generates a fair amount of energy, but needs to be anchored to function. This furnace generator consumes any fuel resource type.

data.block: Better Future Large Skid Landing Gear
data.description: This is a really big Landing Gear Skid. You could use it on a massive flying Tech. That would really be something sweet.
A fixed drill grinder with very dense crystal tips.

This Large Retractable Landing Gear Wheel will raise and lower automatically when your Tech lifts off or lands. It works as a neat little wheel on the ground, and retracts to keep a flush underside to your plane whilst in the air.
Crafted from fibron nanofibre, these wings encompass a design that enables them to maintain low profile radar signature.
Use the radial menu on this block to switch all the hover pads on your Tech on or off. You can even adjust their power output to change hover height higher or lower in the air.
For your inner boy racer. This will keep you grounded at high speeds.
The GSO Scrapper will consume GSO blocks and break them down into their component resource chunks.
A block made out of compressed Carbius for ease of transportation. Produces 42 Carbius bricks when scrapped.
A right wing. For flying!
This refinery changes raw resources into refined ones. It's also mobile, you don't need to have it anchored in order to use it.
A block made out of compressed Olastic for ease of transportation. Produces 8 Olastic bricks when scrapped.
A conveyor that lets you transition from one plane to another. 3D bases!

Once anchored and given time to startup, this SCU will collect nearby blocks and store them in another dimension, to be retrieved through your Inventory. The GeoCorp variant has a very wide grab radius, but also takes longer to power-up when first anchored down.
A medium generator. It is more efficient, yielding more energy per unit of fuel than smaller generators, although it takes longer to burn fuel.

The eggheads in the lab have finally managed to produce this energy weapon that we can mount to a full rotation turret. This aint your average laser pointer, it will really ruin your day if you shine it into your eyes.
Bam! Bam! Bam! Smash! Smash! Smash!
This Dune Wheel is very similar to a Globe Trotter, but with an added fender to keep the dust down and an extra attach point on top.
A block made out of compressed Rodius for ease of transportation. Produces 42 Rodius bricks when scrapped.
This Three Block weighs less than three One Blocks, but it's just as tough. Save some weight and use these multiple blocks!
A medium armour plate. For defence against medium threats.
A wheel enclosed in a casing with a side and top attach point.

This quad barrel launcher fires further and does more damage than the GSO one. It also rotates, it's a little slow, but it does turn. It doesn't have as many barrels, but it makes use of the ones that it has.
The Swipe Collector holds more chunks than any other small collector. It also has a high beam strength to hold chunks on a reasonably fast moving Tech. However it is fairly expensive too.

A small fuel tank to supply the boosters.

What lessons can be learned from the fateful Icarus XIII mission? Captain Jack "Nosey" Pledger gained notoriety early in his career as a pioneer in high altitude flight, and incredible ingenuity, by winning the regional Deben Valley Sumo Tech Championships. Icarus XIII's black box recorder shows that the cause of the failure was forgetting to fill the fuel tanks before the second leg take off. The ship reached low orbit before cutting out and leaving the crew plummeting to their doom. Since then, the introduction of Oleite self-replenishing technologies as seen in all modern fuel tanks have ensured that this kind of tragedy will never happen again.
High rate of fire and medium range. A reliable - if under-powered weapon.
This block can be used to apply rotational force to your Tech whilst in the air or on land too. It can be controlled with normal steering input.

data.block: Better Future Small Angled Halo Wheel
data.description: An entry level Halo wheel. This is a nice slim design for nippy little Techs that want to keep a low profile.

A twin barrel mortar launcher that can rotate all the way around and it can do it fast. Sure, these shells don't hit as hard as the GSO ones, or go quite as far, but they are much better at hitting their mark from a speeding buggy!
This giant booster has a built in fuel tank. It’s designed to help Techs of the larger persuasion to get over those bumps or hills when they’re struggling under their own weight.

The Better Future Air Rig is used as a chassis to build flying bases. Attach a Sky Anchor to the bottom, fill the middle with Hover Pads and Anti Gravity Engines and lift your base to the clouds, out of harms way. This small one is great for building small outposts.

The Air Receiver is first of all a great receiver, but it can also be mounted on a flying Tech and grab chunks that have been shot up towards it by a delivery cannon from below. It's a fairly neat way to get chunks up to a floating base, (it's also a sneaky trick to play on rival prospectors).
A block made out of compressed Luxian for ease of transportation. Produces 42 Luxian crystals when scrapped.
A block made out of compressed Rubber for ease of transportation. Produces 42 Rubber bricks when scrapped.
This Two Block is so great. Look at it. It's like two One Blocks, but stuck together. Nice!
This is a Venture Fixed Anchor, for all you Venture fans who love to make fixed bases… have fun!
A conveyor that carries chunks up and down hills. Tall bases!

A small sloping armour plate built at an angle to deflect projectiles. Part of the Spike armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
Very much like a normal GeoCorp block - but a bit longer.
A light corner block to build Techs with some more interesting streamlined shapes to them. Fancy.
This caterpillar track has a massive carry capacity and excellent offroad grip. It's not very fast though.

This Medium Retractable Landing Gear Wheel will raise and lower automatically when your Tech lifts off or lands. It works as a neat little wheel on the ground, and retracts to keep a flush underside to your plane whilst in the air.
A powerful, persistent beam Laser Cannon that can fire all around in a 360 circle. Codenamed the Flying Saucer Cannon.

The searchlight will scan around and automatically focus on nearby enemies to stop them sneaking up on you.

The off-world frontier is a lawless place. A few lawmen do try to tame the lands. World Police Officer - Mathieu Choiniere. Officer Choiniere is among them, started his off-world career as an engineer when a gang of legion harvester rustlers rolled through his settlement stealing Techs as they went, he was deputised into a posse. After tracking the rustlers, the posse settled in for the night. Little did they know the rustlers were creeping up on their camp to ambush it under the cover of night. Were it not for the watchful eyes of Choiniere and his trusty spotlight, those rustlers may have got the drop on the posse. Choiniere is now a lawman in his own right.

An armoured half two block. Part of the Edge armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
A new and experimental pointer, used to point at things.
A fast firing and powerful streamlined laser weapon. Pew pew pew pew pew pew!

The Zero is a small and powerful propeller with 9 attach points. It's a fairly expensive, but the small size and good power mean they can stack to help give some of the best force for their size, if you can afford them.

data.block: Better Future Stream Corner Two Block
data.description: This works perfectly with the Streamlined Two Block to finish off the corners.
A nice hardy GeoCorp Refinery. There's nothing too special about it, just a solid workhorse to get those raw chunks refined.
The Daddy! This thing is insane. HUUUUUGE Balloon tyres with deep tractor treads. These things are the way up there in all terrain power and speed. They can carry a fair amount too.
A block made out of compressed Luxian for ease of transportation. Produces 8 Luxian crystals when scrapped.

Rudder Tipped Wings have both horizontal and vertical flaps, adding to stability and versatility for minimalist plane designs and enabling grander aircraft an extra free set of tail wing-style vertical rudders.
A small stabiliser wheel used to prop up top heavy Techs.

data.block: Better Future Large Air Rig Extender
data.description: An extender section to modify the Large Air Rig.
This Dune Wheel is very similar to a Globe Trotter, but with an added fender to keep the dust down and an extra attach point on top.
For a more discerning boy racer - less garish… right?
A block made out of compressed Plumbia for ease of transportation. Produces 24 Plumbia ingots when scrapped.
A T-shaped bumper section with 3 attach points. Part of a set of blocks that can be used to make strong bull bars, bumpers and rams.

data.block: Better Future Small Skid Landing Gear
data.description: This Landing Gear Skid will raise and lower automatically when your Tech lifts off or lands. It just works!

data.block: Better Future Large Straight Halo Wheel
data.description: Large Halo wheels are powerful, fast and fairly light.
An extra supporting wheel, usually underslung on wings to add stability.
A Streamlined internal filling corner Block. Perfect for soothing out sloping internal corner sections. Joins up well with the Blanked Out One Blocks.
A large and strong rotating anchor with a high amount of armour. It does rotate slower than the GSO alternative, but it's tough as nails.
Chassis Blocks are very light and very strong. Use these to fill up the empty space on the inside of a Tech instead of big heavy One Blocks.

Delivery Cannons sell unwanted items back to Earth earning money. This one is static, it will only work whilst anchored.

Low orbital interplanetary relay (LOIR) is a method was pioneered by Dr. Bernard Steen. Steen developed the process to smuggle controlled substances from one planet to another with efficiency and anonymity. On the ground a 'Delivery Cannon' is loaded with the object one wishes to send. It then blasts the payload into low orbit where a radio-controlled relay satellite collects it and sends it on the desired trajectory through space to its destination. Steen was eventually caught by the authority. He avoided prison by striking a deal to "share" the process with off-world mining corporations and interplanetary postal services. He even receives a 1% cut from the profit of each item that is sent. He currently splits his time between Titan and Mars as a tax-exile.

A powerful pulse booster jet in a small package.

The Little Stud Pulse Booster system was created by a Metal Machinist known as Big Will McDonald. McDonald's breakthrough came whilst working on the "Space Fill" project, the idea was to avoid polluting the Earth by forgoing landfills in favour of blasting waste materials into outer space. The original problem was the expense of the process, it simply didn't make economic sense to pay for the fuel required. However, thanks to the combined breakthroughs of Oleite self-replenishing fuel tanks and McDonald's super efficient pulse booster technology, which many have described as "beyond effective", we no longer have to worry about the vast amounts of mess and wastage we produce as a species. We're now safe in the knowledge that we can just shoot it away into space for someone else to worry about!
A good starting solar generator. It will convert sunlight into electricity whilst anchored, but becomes overburdened easily.
A weapon mounting system usually used for under wing armaments. This versatile piece of kit can be used in any orientation as required.
Twice the power, twice the spread. These floods will light up any work area you point them at.

data.block: Better Future Stream Wide Two Block
data.description: This Wide Streamlined Corner works with well with the Streamlined Two Blocks. If you want to go for that wide flatter look. It's pretty good, I guess.
This Tip Wing can be used either as an end for the Middle Wing Sections or as a handy Tail Wing alternative.

data.block: Better Future One Face Blank Block
data.description: This One Block has a single blanked out face, but no attach point on top. It's useful for filling in a seamless white finish for your Better Future Tech.

data.block: Better Future Left Large Hover Flipper
data.description: A big tough Flipper Hover. This is the Left one. Built in-steering, vectored thrusting internal hover ring. What more can I say?

This mobile generator will burn fuel resource chunks whilst on the move and doesn't need to be anchored. It's big and fairly tough, but it also gives a better output of energy than the GSO mobile generator. Let's go burn!
A small industrial use Collector. It can carry a lot, but only at a slower speed.

data.block: Better Future Medium Angled Halo Wheel
data.description: The Medium Halo wheels are fast, responsive and look awesomely futuristic.
This digger dumper scoop is great for flipping enemies. Not so useful for gathering resources.
A repair bubble. It will repair damaged blocks if powered up.
A tactical four pack Block. Heavy, hard and tough. Just like the two block, but twice as big.
An angled half block corner section which is specially hardened to withstand great force and angled to deflect most incoming strikes.
This Block will add a Power Gauge to the HUD which will display how much energy is stored on your Tech's batteries.
Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
The Venture Contact Shotgun is a powerful weapon to use at close range, but it won't work very well from a distance.
This small spoiler is perfect for providing a bit of down force on a small scout vehicle. It also has 3 Attach Points - what a treat!
A block made out of compressed Plumbia for ease of transportation. Produces 120 Plumbia ingots when scrapped.
This is a GeoCorp A.I. Guard Module, an autonomous drone brain that can drive a tech automatically for you.
Perfect for scout vehicles. This wheel is fast and has plenty of attach points to load up a smaller Tech with some reasonable firepower.

This handy weapon has been a reliable favourite for over 200 years and still going strong.

The ZK-47 (also known as the Kempykov) is an assault rifle, developed for the Galactic Survey Organisation by Sargent Peter Kempton-Bass. At the outbreak of the first Gamma Quadrant War (GQW1), Kempton-Bass joined the Stella-Royal Marines Commandos Regiment. During the conflict, Kempton-Bass notched up over 300 confirmed kills and lost his mind. After the war, he retired to his undersea lair and began tinkering on various projects to keep himself amused. The ZK-47 was originally created, whilst trying to find a low-cost alternative to text messages. However, the GSO in its wisdom saw other applications for the Kempykov.
Quiet, small and minimal kickback. This is just the tool for a smaller Tech that doesn't want to be thrown around by a large weapon (or to fill up some empty spaces with some more guns).

data.block: Better Future Large Side Halo Wheel
data.description: Large Halo wheels are powerful, fast and fairly light.
This handy six pack block helps to build larger Techs in shorter amounts of time. Stop fiddling around with those ones and twos and get on with it.
A large Block Magnet that will attract and hold any nearby loose blocks.
This Payload Terminal specialises in selling Hawkeye Blocks.
A block made out of compressed Celestian for ease of transportation. Produces 42 Celestian crystals when scrapped.
This caterpillar track has a massive carry capacity and excellent offroad grip. It's not very fast though.
The ultra-thin lightbar can be mounted on the underside of Techs to add an awesome under-glow.

data.block: Better Future Stream Wide Five Right Block
data.description: You know that old saying - "Where there's a Wide Five Left Streamlined Block, you'll probably also find a Wide Five Right Streamlined Block." Something to think about there.
Your huge monster style GeoCorp wheel.
The "Seeker" guided missile system is loaded with 2 heat seeking "Warhammer" missiles. Seekers are a versatile tool, with ground-to-air, air-to-air and air-to-ground capabilities.
Crafted from fibron nanofibre, these wings encompass a design that enables them to maintain low profile radar signature.
A fair sized hard wearing metal wheel for hazardous terrain.
Double-sized GSO block for constructing the basic stucture of a Tech.
The Hawkeye Counter A.I. Module is a tough unit that acts as the brain for autonomous attack Techs.

data.block: Better Future Class D Laser Ray
data.description: A heavy-duty, slow-firing, powerful laser cannon. It's also streamlined so it looks nice while it's not being used as it will fold away.

data.block: Better Future Right Large Hover Flipper
data.description: The Right Large Hover Flipper is possibly even better than the Left version. I sometimes have trouble choosing though. They're both so good!
A medium sized mix silo. This one will take multiple types of chunks at a time.
Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
This block is four units long.

This is just for looks, but what looks it offers! Wanna add mecha style 'bunny ear' bits to your Tech? Here you go! Need an awesome tail thing to finish off your hover jet powered flying whale tank? Here you go!
A block made out of compressed Erudian for ease of transportation. Produces 64 Erudian crystals when scrapped.
This is the fastest turning Rotating Anchor available. Just don't expect it to carry too much weight though. It's a great choice for light defence turrets that need to target fast moving targets.
An incredibly resilient run-flat tyre encased within ACNR housing.
A mid set alternative to the Springer wheel. Boing!

data.block: Hawkeye Active All Axis Horizon Gyro
data.description: A more powerful gyroscope to keep your Techs level, no matter what. This gyro is "active", meaning it will apply torque to force your Tech back to an upright position. And it's also "all axis", meaning it works in all three rotational directions.
A block made out of compressed Luxian for ease of transportation. Produces 64 Luxian crystals when scrapped.
A block made out of compressed Erudian for ease of transportation. Produces 8 Erudian crystals when scrapped.

A medium armoured extender block. Part of the Wrap Armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.

data.block: Better Future Streamline Extender Four Block
data.description: Oh boy! Another Streamlined Extender Block? This one is good to be used with the Four Wide Corner Blocks.

Fabricators take two or more resource chunks and craft them into a block.

The GSO Fabricator was first devised by Dr. Lawrence Hartley during his work on the Good Day Project. The original inspiration for the Fabricator came from a vintage sci-fi TV show, aired in the late 20th century, in this show a device called a 'Replicator' could make any food instantly from pure energy. Dr.'s Hartley and Phuquestayne saw the potential applications for a real replication device and began work on this project together. Their labour soon bore fruit in the form of a prototype device that they dubbed, the Fabricator. Operators could combine different materials in this machine and it would produce something completely new.

The smallest and most economically priced tank track available. This hardy little workhorse provides enough grunt to shift a fairly substantial load over rough terrain and steeper inclines. If in doubt, add more Techa Tracks.

data.block: Better Future Small Flipper Hover Right
data.description: These Small Hover Flippers are excellent advanced hover blocks. The internal hover ring will angle itself to give you some steering (vectored thrust), but this block also has built in Adjustment Thrusters.
A cow catcher style plough to push everything out of the way.
A strong and light and large block.
A bent bumper corner piece. Part of a set of blocks that can be used to make strong bull bars, bumpers and rams.

A sleek rocket shaped headlight. A design classic that will endure for all ages.

The final performance by infamous poet, Jock Silver was for an off-world jamboree. A giant stage was constructed and lined with footlights that lit his every move upon the boards, the audience gathered, the curtains were drawn and Silver took the stage for one last time. He entranced the crowd at once, flipping back and forth, bamboozling them with his nimble verse. The crowd was transfixed and enthralled until one prospector noticed Silver's accomplice - Noah Webster was busy stealing, scrapping and selling all of their Techs from the parking area. Silver had been distracting the crowd to cover the caper. So goes the story of the final performance of Jock Silver, as neither he nor Webster was ever heard from again.
A block made out of compressed Olastic for ease of transportation. Produces 120 Olastic bricks when scrapped.
A block made out of compressed Rubber for ease of transportation. Produces 64 Rubber bricks when scrapped.
A block made out of compressed Titania for ease of transportation. Produces 24 Titania ingots when scrapped.

This shield bubble is small, but has a good amount of soak and a low drain on power.

BitMage is a wandering false prophet and con artist. One unlucky sap that fell foul of his schemes was Theus_TM, a close friend of the assassination android known as MurderBot. MurderBot and Theus chased BitMage all the way back to his shanty shack with every intention of breaking BitMage into tiny pieces. But BitMage made it back just in time to throw up his trusty shield projector. The generator then promptly broke and the shield quit. BitMage heard the squeak of wheels lurching forward. In desperation, BitMage gave the generator a tremendous kick, and it spluttered back to life shooting the shield back up, before failing again. But, Murderbot had surged forward and got caught mid-beam, splitting him neatly in two.

This Solar Panel will generate electricity for any Tech it's attached to, whilst that Tech is anchored. This block doesn't have a built-in anchor itself though as it's designed to be used mainly on floating Better Future bases that use Sky Anchors.
This repair bubble projector is a medium size, heals at a moderate rate and has a moderate power drain.

data.block: Better Future Stream Wide Four Left Block
data.description: A Left Wide Four Corner Streamlined Block. That's a bit of a mouthful isn't it.
This SCU Storage Device can be used without being anchored. It has a shorter range than the anchored one, but it's pretty convenient nonetheless.
This A.I. module is great for building scouts.
A jumping jack bracket with 6 Attach Points and a lighter overall weight than a regular block.
What’s better than one big Auto Cannon? Two slightly smaller ones of course! These will really chew them up.
A useful bracket system for versatility when building unusual Techs.
These powerful Adjustment Thruster units can give more air control to heavy hovering Techs.
The Riser Wheel lifts a Tech up off the ground high enough to avoid getting snagged on the crest of hills and mountains.
A block made out of compressed Carbius for ease of transportation. Produces 24 Carbius bricks when scrapped.
A right angle bracket piece. A sturdy and lightweight solution for when you want to stick that thing on the side.

This Anti-Gravity Engine (AGE) reduces the effects of gravity on the attached blocks within its area of influence. This one is more powerful than the Pip Engine, but less powerful than the Eco Engine. It also has a larger area of influence, but it also consumes more power to use. You can double AGEs up to reduce gravity even further all the way down to zero gravity.
This drill will serve any new prospector well enough in their mining efforts.
A more versatile Railgun fixed to a rotating turret mount. It loses some power due to the snub-nosed barrel, but it makes up for it by being more likely to hit the mark.
A large hex faced shield generator that provides a good amount of protection, but also consumes a lot of power.

data.block: Better Future Small Flipper Hover Left
data.description: These Small Hover Flippers are excellent advanced hover blocks. The internal hover ring will angle itself to give you some steering (vectored thrust), but this block also has built in Adjustment Thrusters.
A block made out of compressed Celestian for ease of transportation. Produces 64 Celestian crystals when scrapped.

This large Block Magnet is perfect for heavy industrial use, and I do mean heavy. This thing weighs 22 tons! It will grab and hold more blocks and pull them from much further away than the puny GSO ones.

A 420mm M-Grade Gun. Technically a naval class weapon, but you can mount it on anything that's big enough to carry it.

Of German origin, the gun was mainly designed by SRQ Technologies Director of Design, Senior Ra'Gequi. It can fire a 820kg high explosive shell roughly 8 miles.
A block made out of compressed Celestian for ease of transportation. Produces 24 Celestian crystals when scrapped.
A small armour plate. For defence against small threats.
This GeoCorp repair bubble covers a much larger space then the GSO one. However it also requires a lot more power to maintain.
A GeoCorp Scrapper will consume any GeoCorp block and turn them into resource chunks that you can sell or use to craft other blocks.
A block made out of compressed Rodius for ease of transportation. Produces 64 Rodius capsules when scrapped.

A more mid range gyroscope to keep your Techs level, no matter what. This gyro is "active", meaning it will apply torque to force your Tech back to an upright position. And it's also "all axis", meaning it works in all three rotational directions. This is more powerful than the Better Future and Hawkeye gyroscopes.
This will tell you how high above or below sea level you are. It doesn't mention which direction the sea is in though… hmmm…
A heavier drain than the GSO Bubble, but also has a larger size and repair rate.
The most compact high performance off-road wheel around. Very nippy motors that may be a bit tricky for newer explorers to handle. These will get you from A to B in no time at all.
A conveyor that lets you transition from one plane to another. 3D bases!
A flat bracket. This bracket is sturdy and light. Just 4 attach points though.
A solid basic cannon turret. Very little but packs a nice punch.
A tri-corner bumper section with 3 attach points. Part of a set of blocks that can be used to make strong bull bars, bumpers and rams.
A block made out of compressed Ignian for ease of transportation. Produces 64 Ignian crystals when scrapped.
This block upgrades the basic compass to a full radar, giving information on friendlies, enemies and mission locations.

The Better Future Air Rig is used as a chassis to build flying bases. Attach a Sky Anchor to the bottom, fill the middle with Hover Pads and Anti Gravity Engines and lift your base to the clouds, out of harms way. This medium one is good for more comprehensive structures.
This Medium Hover Ring has no built-in adjustment thrusters, but it can rotate its hover emitter to give some vectored thrust steering.
The Venture radar helps scouts avoid larger enemies.
Dinky wheels but they turn and will steer better than their big brothers.
The Speed Lance Laser is strong and versatile weapon. It has a wide arc of fire and deals a good amount of damage.

The Better Future Air Rig is used as a chassis to build flying bases. Attach a Sky Anchor to the bottom, fill the middle with Hover Pads and Anti Gravity Engines and lift your base to the clouds, out of harms way. This large one is for building huge flying fortresses.
This handy Mobile Furnace Generator can be used on a mobile Tech to consume fuel chunks on the move and create electricity.
A double barrelled rocket launcher with a twist. Use these fireworks to cause explosive damage to enemies, or to celebrate and have some fun!

data.block: Better Future Stream Corner Three Block
data.description: This works well to finish off the corners for the Streamlined Three Blocks. You're really into reading the descriptions of fairly standard blocks aren't you? Let's throw in a little factoid to spice things up: did you know that owls can turn their heads up to 270 degrees? Now you do.
Look at this tiny booster! It really packs a good punch though. Remember to take a Fuel Tank with you to keep your Booster stocked and ready to go when you need it in a pinch.
A wing section that can be used to make a wider wingspan and give more lift to a flying Tech.
A small battery. Has a capacity over 8x larger than a GSO battery, although it doesn't come cheap.
Light and cheap. This will make for a speedy racer - but wont stand up to punishment.
A block made out of compressed Olastic for ease of transportation. Produces 42 Olastic brick when scrapped.

The Hover Rings are more powerful than the flipper variants. They can lift more weight with ease. Whilst they don't feature integrated directional Hover Steering jets, the hover rings are mounted on gimbals and used vectored thrusting to help steer on their own.
This anchored A.I. Sentry is great for home defence. Even its own built in mini-auto cannon packs a hefty punch. Equip it with more firepower to really send those unwanted visitors packing.
This will chew up anything you press it against in a matter of seconds.
A fast and grippy off-road track, great for taking rough terrain at speed. Less good for carrying heavy weight or damage.
A mini drill. This is a great starter drill for any budding off world prospector.

Listen up Meatheads! This is the one you've been waiting for. A heavy payload fixed mortar launcher. This baby isn't the fastest firing mortar, but it has a long reach and it will really ruin someone's day when the shell hits them.
A Fabricator to craft GeoCorp blocks with. Put resources in and get blocks out.
A small fixed light that won't interfere with the clean lines of your Better Future Tech.
A powerful smart missile that will actively seek targets and cause a massive amount of damage on impact.
A Venture tail wing.

A medium sloping armour plate built at an angle to deflect projectiles. Part of the Spike armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
This is a great upgrade from the Small Ion Drive. Again, this one doesn't need power or fuel. It works very much like a propeller, but the sleek design opens up a whole new world of building options.
Dugga! Dugga! Dugga! Bang! Bang! Bang!
A large GSO wheel that can be used to build larger GSO Techs that can scale steeper hills.
A terminal that can be used to purchase additional Techs and blocks. They will be delivered to your location via a planetfall payload drop.
One of the largest and highest floating hover platforms available. This makes for a perfect perch to rain down fire from above, just so long as you can control where it drifts.
This Component Dongle can be attached to a Component Factory to allow it to produce Complex Component Chunks.

This Plasma Furnace generator burns fuel chunks to produce electricity. This generator can burn any refined or unrefined chunks (no components though). It won't give you the best return in terms of energy produced on whatever you burn, but it's not picky, it will burn pretty much any resource chunks.
A large big daddy fuel can.

A medium armoured corner half block. Part of the Edge armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
Heavy duty protection for any industrial equipment.
A Five Block that weighs less than five individual One Blocks? Awesome! And it's as strong as all those One Blocks would be combined? Cool.
This versatile propeller can be used in just about any configuration and will generate powerful lift. It also converts any linear axis that it is aligned with into a throttle input.
A mobile delivery cannon, perfect for selling resource chunks on the move.
These babies are nice and cheap and let everyone around know where your Tech is to avoid workplace accidents.

data.block: Better Future Passive All Axis Gyro
data.description: This Passive Gyroscope doesn't apply torque to keep your Tech upright, only resistance to movements around all rotational axes. Active gyros apply torque, meaning they'll pick you up if you fall over, but passive gyros just make it harder to fall over in the first place, making your Tech more stable without impacting your control of it as much. Passive Gyros also behave differently depending on their placement on your Tech. Depending on the offset from the centre of gravity this gyro will affect some axes more than others.

A versatile explosive bolt with 6 attach points. As with the 2-way version, this block is a single use item that will self destruct when you trigger it. Its primarily used to split one large Tech into several smaller ones without damaging them.
This manufacturing block can be attached to any conveyor to let the held chunk be picked off and dropped onto the floor.
Very fast racing wheels with slick tyres and hard suspension. These are not off-road tyres so they lack friction on sand and pebbles, but they are the fastest wheels around.
Heavy duty protection for any industrial equipment.
A block made out of compressed Plumbia for ease of transportation. Produces 42 Plumbia ingots when scrapped.

This Large Skid acts as a simple, no nonsense landing foot to perch your VTOL craft on whilst grounded. It’s not much use as a wheel, but it will keep the underside of your flying Techs scrape-free when landing.
A hub style wheel with a sturdy chassis that can have other blocks mounted to it.
A small capacity battery but very light and less explosive too.

The "Storm" is a mid-range rotor which will generate a significant amount of lift. The variable blades can shift to spin in either direction depending on placement, allowing for stability regardless of position. It also converts any linear axis that it is aligned with into a throttle input. Use the Helicopter Control Scheme’s Lift controls to Ascend and Descend when a Rotor is vertically aligned. If aligned to other directions (Acceleration or Strafe), then Rotors will work with those controls instead.
The REAL Daddy! Words can't describe the awesomness of this balloon tyre with deep tractor treads. These things are the ultimate in all terrain power and speed. They can carry a fair amount too.
Advanced issue GSO Collector for transporting up to 20 resources to the desired destination.

data.block: Better Future Two Face Blank Block
data.description: This One Block has two blanked out white faces, each with no attach points on them. It's useful for filling in a seamless white finish for your Better Future Tech.

This is a gigantic Delivery Cannon used to blast resource chunks out to orbital relay stations that collect the chunks and send them on. Sending chunks away with this will earn you money. It must be anchored to function. It is usually fed chunks via Conveyors or Silos.

The Venture 1-Way Adjustment Thruster is a great block for adding precision controls to a hover or flying Tech in a single direction only. Unlike the 5-way version, this block lets you limit the exact direction of force.
A right Venture expander wing.
A rugged off-road wheel, strong and manoeuvrable. Just the job for low-key scouting vehicles.
Chassis Blocks are very light and very strong. Use these to fill up the empty space on the inside of a Tech instead of big heavy One Blocks.

Your standard Venture cab. Comes with orange windscreen.

Building upon his earlier successes with the Venture bracket system, Prof. Ruin of the Idont Institut tackled a much more complex project when he was approached again by Venture to devise an all-terrain Cab that could operate independently at high speeds under testing conditions. Prof. Ruin's POD Cab was a roaring success. The nippy little thing handles dunes and mountains with ease and is fast enough to make a quick exit when needed. It also comes equipped with a built-in PIP rifle, the little brother of the popular Venture Hail Fire. Ruin also had plans to include built-in missile launchers and a radar, but alas, they proved too expensive for the Venture brief. Ruin's next project for Venture is still a closely guarded secret, although insider reports have revealed that the project's codename is "The Tower".

The GSO Auto Miner can be anchored on top of patches of ground that are rich in Carbite, Oleite, Rodite, Erudite, Ignite & Celestite. The Auto Miner will then commence drilling and extract the subterranean ore to be harvested.
Lighter and cheaper to build than the GeoCorp Long block - but less Attach Points.

This gimbal mounted Plasma cutter is a great tool for zapping those hard to reach resources. Oh wait, for some reason it locks onto target other Techs? Well that's odd… I'm sure they'll sort out that bug out with a firmware update later. Anyway, although you gain in freedom of movement, it is a little less potent in the power department, but it has a slightly longer range than other Plasma Cutters to make up for it.

An explosive bolt which delivers a hard inertia kick and only minimal damage to nearby blocks when triggered. This block is a single use item. When attached to a Tech, it will self-destruct when you trigger it. This allows you to build multiple Techs within Techs to be converted on the fly.
The Axis Shotgun is mounted on a fully rotating turret. It has a little less power than the Bayonet Shotgun, takes up more space and fires a tad slower, but makes up for it in versatility.

The heaviest ballistic weapon currently licensed for use in off-world colonies. This battleship class gun has an incredibly long range and high power. It will not rotate, so whatever weapons platform you attach it to will need to do most of the aiming. But when it is on target it will really make a mess. These super heavyweight ballistics take a long time to reload too, so make sure it's on target when pressing the fire button.
A block made out of compressed Fibron for ease of transportation. Produces 8 Fibron chunks when scrapped.

This Small Skid acts as a simple, no nonsense landing foot to perch your VTOL craft on whilst grounded. It’s not much use as a wheel, but it will keep the underside of your flying Techs scrape-free when landing.
This Large Armour Plate is tougher than the GSO and GeoCorp ones, but it's also more expensive.
Connect this Filter to a Conveyor loop. Imprint it with an item by dragging the item on top of it. Once imprinted it will filter that item out from the rest.
The GSO Anchored A.I. Module makes building turrets even easier. It will rotate a full 360 degrees and shoot at any Enemy Techs that it can spot.

Look at the size of this Hover Ring. What a beauty. Just like the smaller versions, this one doesn't have built in Hover Steering, but it's one of the most powerful hovers (for its size) and it can shift the direction of the Hover Ring to give it some basic steering.
This block adds a Altimeter element to your HUD. Altimeters tell you how far from sea level you are.

The Hawkeye Fabricator will take Resource Chunks and turn them into Hawkeye Blocks.

The Hawkeye Fabricator is, in part based on the notorious quantum-computer technology, project S.Y.L.V.E.R. The team behind the S.Y.L.V.E.R. project stirred up deep concerns after announcing that their learning computer had achieved singularity. Fortunately rather than pursuing a goal of obliterating mankind, the self-aware S.Y.L.V.E.R. entity instead seemed more interested in designing and crafting powerful high-end Blocks. Dr Praz, a developer on the project, realised the obvious practical application and the project was converted into a Fabricator.
The Better Future Artificial Intelligence Module is a clever controller that acts as the brain for autonomous Techs.
The big boy. This spotlight will automatically search out nearby enemies to save you from nasty surprises.

GeoCorp, making a Hover Pad? But they don't have any way to steer it… or propel it… But look at the size of this thing! Do you know how much it can lift? No? Neither do I, but I bet that it's a lot! Oh boy!

A large explosive bolt with loads of attach points. This block is a single use item. When attached to a Tech, it will self-destruct when you trigger it. This allows you to build multiple Techs within Techs to be converted on the fly without damaging the blocks.

data.block: Better Future Stream Corner Five Block
data.description: Wow, this is a really big Streamlined Corner Block - five long huh? That is really something! Hoo wee! Well, blow me over with a feather.
A very powerful Adjustment Thruster module. This can be built into the inside of your Tech if you plan carefully. Works great for guiding your ungrounded Techs through the air.
This excellent cross shaped Tail Wing is perfect to use as a rudder to steer your planes.
This is just a mirrored version of the other Z-shaped Block. Do we really need two awkward Z-shaped Blocks? Two of them? Seriously?
A Venture Conveyor can hold and pass chunks along to other connected conveyors or manufacturing blocks.
This rugged Refinery will support all your enriching needs in even the most troubled hotspots.
This sleek Refinery will support all of your enriching needs.
Chassis Blocks are very light and very strong. Use these to fill up the empty space on the inside of a Tech instead of big heavy One Blocks.
A large Outside Corner Bumper with 2 attach points. Part of a set of blocks that can be used to make strong bull bars, bumpers and rams.
Delivery Cannons sell unwanted items back to Earth earning money. This one is mobile and does not require anchoring to function.

The Trim Gyro is technically an Active Single Axis Gyro (like the one that's good for motorcycles). But it also allows you to set an offset angle for the Gyro to tilt your Tech to. Attach it and access its radial menu to switch the trim feature on or off. Whilst on, you can adjust the pitch angle at which it will attempt to hold your Tech in the air. This enables you to make diagonal builds that sit at the angle you want them to or make awesome flying Techs that keep an aggressive nose down posture.
A short angled fork version of the Springer wheel. Wheeeee!
A short range, high damage projectile weapon. This functions much like a Shotgun, but instead of physical projectiles, it uses energy blasts which give no kickback. It is rather expensive though.
A half block corner. To be used in the corners. Next to half blocks. Also armour plated.
A good sized fuel tank with some nice curved edges. This will provide plenty of fuel for your Boosters.
This Collector will not hold many resource chunks, but it will hold on to the ones that it takes tightly, even at high speeds.

data.block: Better Future Stream Wide Three Right Block
data.description: This is the Wide Right Streamlined Corner block to match the Wide Left variant. Stick these on the edges of a Streamlined Three Block section to get that cool wide look that everyone is always going on about.
Allows for the charge of batteries and transfer of energy from generators or charged batteries on one Tech, to another. Medium range, medium arc speed and medium arc power.
A Streamlined One Block, perfect for sloping mid sections. Joins up well with the Streamlined Corner One Block.
A basic stud style fixed light. It won't shine very far, but it doesn't cost much either.
A block made out of compressed Rodius for ease of transportation. Produces 24 Rodius capsules when scrapped.
A block made out of compressed Fibron for ease of transportation. Produces 120 Fibron chunks when scrapped.
A block made out of compressed Carbius for ease of transportation. Produces 120 Carbius bricks when scrapped.
The Resource Receiver takes new chunks into a base ready to circulate them.
This thing makes your Tech look like an F1 car and works as a spoiler.

The Sky Anchor allows you to anchor hovercraft and anti-gravity Techs. It can also be used to anchor large Techs with high ground clearance. The Sky Anchor fires a ground hook which embeds into the ground and then holds your Tech in place with a bonding beam.
A solid mid-range booster. It's not as powerful as something from Venture, but it doesn't drain your fuel as fast either.
A block made out of compressed Ignian for ease of transportation. Produces 8 Ignian crystals when scrapped.

The Air Brake is mainly used for ungrounded Techs (hovercraft, planes, helicopters etc.), It will provide passive braking in a given direction when no input is detected. In other words, it'll slow you down when you stop driving, but only in the direction the Tech is facing.
A very small but reasonably powerful rotor. Remember to use a control scheme that has lift controls to operate a vertically aligned rotor.

The Air Brake is mainly used for ungrounded Techs (hovercraft, planes, helicopters etc.), It will provide passive braking in a given direction when no input is detected. In other words, it'll slow you down when you stop driving, but only in the direction it is facing.
A long angled fork version of the Springer wheel. Go!
Roughly twice as powerful as the Megaton Cannon, but fires at half the speed. This cannon is bigger, heavier and tougher, but boy, does it go with a bang!
The old faithful STEN light machine gun. A favourite for low key ops.
A Venture Resource Receiver can hold and pass chunks even at higher speeds, but it only has a stack height of 1 - which isn't very many.

A high explosive charge that you can detonate at any time. Careful - it will cause damage to anything within range when it's triggered. This block is a single use item. When attached to a Tech, it will self-destruct when you trigger it. This allows you to build multiple Techs within Techs to be converted on the fly without damaging the blocks.

This fast firing NEEDLE laser will chip away at its target with a furious rain of laser bolts. It can't rotate all the way around, so you'll need to position it manually. It also gets pretty hot when it's been firing for a while, so no touchy!
A tiny little diddly wing. This works well as a tail wing, or as a wing tip for the edge bits on your awesome flying Tech.

data.block: Better Future Medium Air Rig Extender
data.description: An extender section to modify the Medium Air Rig.
A block made out of compressed Ignian for ease of transportation. Produces 42 Ignian crystals when scrapped.
The Alternator Conveyor is a special type of Conveyor that will send the items that reach it alternating different directions.

The Big Man - things are getting serious now. A high explosive bomb to be used in air to ground combat. Just make sure you don't use this the wrong way up or you might accidentally have it go off on your own Tech.
A large hover pad. From the future!

data.block: Better Future Active All Axis Gyro
data.description: This Active All Axis Gyro is great at stabilising hover craft and air craft Techs. It will apply torque in all directions to keep your Tech level. Do you just need to keep something upright? Use this. This one is more powerful than Venture's one, but less powerful than the GSO one.
A longer version of the half block. Also armour plated.
A block made out of compressed Titania for ease of transportation. Produces 64 Titania ingots when scrapped.

The GSO Missile Battery really brings the pain. Four lock-on missiles can be launched from this pod in quick succession. They take a while to reload, but they also pack a punch when they hit, so it's not usually a problem. Their range isn't as far as Hawkeye, but they're more powerful than Venture.
A very hard wearing wheel and an entry level heavy lifting wheel that can carry much higher capacity loads than most other basic corporation wheels. This is really built for a hard day's work.

This Flamethrower is great for showing off to your friends whilst doing wheelies. It's not much good for, you know, fighting or mining or anything.

Many say that Dr. Lawrence Hartley was a deeply changed man following the demise of this collegue-come-rival Dr. Dick Phuquestayne following their completion of the Fabricator project. Hartley stepped down as chair of the Good Day Project and returned with his family to his native Canada. During this stage in his career, he turned away from inventions for the good of mankind and instead, to the surprise of many began work on weapons technologies. His efforts included the so called the 'Fusion Toothbrush', which would explode 30 seconds after it was turned on and the Reaper X1 Flamethrower, a devastating pyrotechnic weapon that he sold to the Venture corporation. Recent rumours suggest that he has turned a corner and may be in talks to take up his position at the Good Day Project once again.
Radical! What's better than one booster? Two Boosters! Two Double Boosters, no wait, that would be four boosters, this is one double booster, two jets in total. Let's not get carried away.
This streamlined medium dinosaur head shaped block helps to neaten up the lines of your Venture Tech and also trades fewer Attach Points for a bit more armour.
A block made out of compressed Rubber for ease of transportation. Produces 8 Rubber bricks when scrapped.
The mid-range Adjustment Thruster, a good all rounder. Just like the others, this one can be built into your Tech to hide it away.
A high-explosive grenade launcher that lobs adhesive projectiles, that stick to whatever they hit. Once the fuse on each bomb runs out, it will explode whether it is stuck to a target or not.
This light flashes red or green depending on placement - red for port, green for starboard.
This Better Future Battery can be charged up with any generator, or via a Wireless Charger from another powered Tech.
The biggest GSO wheel around. This isn't as powerful as GeoCorp, as fast as Venture or as strong as Hawkeye, but it's a reliable old workhorse that sits between them all.
An Assault Laser that can be front mounted and concealed within your Tech’s hull. This weapon has a more narrow arc of fire than the Streamlined Assault Laser, but it packs more of a punch.

A real off-world miner's cab, for doing heavy work.

A bossy guy known as Joe Williams Huston created this cab so he could monitor his workers. In this cab he could play cards, watch, TV and sleep. He was later presumed dead from the cab dislodging itself from his over watch while making blueprints for the last and final version of the cab. The blueprints were uncovered years later and applied to the 19th Edition Foreman Cab though he himself was never found. The new cabs now look like a penthouse with a built in pool and contain cup holders, finally. The cab is banned in over 3000 planets due to workers slacking off and is referred to as "Huston" by GeoCorp on those planets. Most haven't caught on to the code word yet.
The Windmill Flail Guard is a professional version of the Cat Nine Flail Guard. A much heavier hitting tool, that can be fitted to Techs with a much higher ground clearance.
A tough little fuel tank. Make sure to take one of these with you if you're using Boosters.

data.block: Better Future Stream Wide Three Left Block
data.description: These Corner Wide blocks get a bit tricky now. You'll need both a left and a right variant to round off the wide corners on a sloping Streamlined Three Block section. I know it's a pain, but what can you do?
Perfect for scout vehicles. This wheel is fast and has plenty of attach points to load up a smaller Tech with some reasonable firepower.
The silo holds a single stack of one type of resource chunks to be used later. It will only take in a single type of chunk, the first one it gets.
A refinery allows you to refine raw resources into something more valuable.
Use this powerful Middle Wing to build flying Techs with magnificent wing spans.

data.block: Better Future Stream Extender Three Block
data.description: I know what you're thinking. "Oh my gosh! they do a Streamline Extender that is Three Blocks long?" You're darn right my friend. Stick a Three Wide Corner Block on the end of this and you've got yourself something pretty special, let me tell you.
A Venture Scrapper, reduces Venture blocks to their component resources.
This block is slightly longer than a two block.

data.block: Better Future Small Long Halo Wheel
data.description: A longer forked version of the entry level Halo wheel. This is a nice slim design for nippy little Techs that want to keep a low profile.
This Hawkeye Rotating Anchor is pretty powerful. It can handle a fairly heavy load and still rotate at a reasonable speed. Faster than GeoCorp, but slower than GSO.
A highly compressed fuel tank which will refill relatively quickly too.

The Linear Motion Engine does exactly what you'd expect. It provides throttled motion along a linear axis with the use of anti-gravity technology. It'll lift your Tech up and down, left and right or forwards and back with a set of your throttle so no need to feather the controls. These are a great movement block to use for anti-gravity Techs.
A fixed anchor with attach points to build out from.

This Small Armour Plate is tougher than the GSO one, but it's also more expensive and heavier.

This armour plating was developed by Dr. D. Noaksey, a biologist of the Independent Game and Fisheries Advocates Association. He originally wanted to build frog armour to save an endangered species from becoming roadkill. The discovery and implementation of aggregated carbon nanorods that Dr. Noaksey developed, allowed the minerals to be put into a state of a temporal flux making it a pliable material to allow its application to a surface to increase its defensive structure, making it possible to fabricate small armoured suits for the rare Green Peppered Frog to wear which were flexible enough for the frog to move around in and could withstand the pressure of having a tank rolled over them.
A sloping Five Block. There isn't much more to say about this.
A complete bumper section with straight middles and corners at each end spanning 4 units across. Part of a set of blocks that can be used to make strong bull bars, bumpers and rams.

This Anti-Gravity Engine (AGE) requires power to function. Once working, it will reduce the effects of gravity on the attached Blocks within its area of influence. This is only a small one, great for starting out. It will reduce gravity by half on its blocks. For greater reductions in gravity and areas of influence you'll want a larger one. Make sure to use gyros, hover pads, propellers, wings and boosters to maintain control of your Tech with reduced gravity.
A corner bracket used to take up less space allowing you to attach parts for less weight than a regular block.
A Hawkeye Fixed Anchor. Place it on the ground and build an anchored base around it. Just don't expect it to rotate OK? It's also pretty tough.
Affectionately dubbed "The Tickler", this chain gun is a single barrel belt driven weapon that packs a hefty punch.
An enclosed propeller fan to propel you forwards and upwards!
Like a regular block but halved to make nice smooth edges. Also armour plated.
A mini wing. Can be used for lift - or can be rotated for a spoiler.

They said it couldn't be done. A laser weapon mounted to a rotating turret? "Nah, can't be done" said the boffins at GSO and Hawkeye. Well look who cracked it - Venture! Sure, it's lost a bit of power in the production process, but the trade off for a wider range of attack is worth it, right? Oh darn, it doesn't tilt up and down very much… Hmmm.
This is a One Block, but with a little hat on it. Cute huh?

A Singularity Containment Unit Storage Device. This clever gizmo creates a wormhole to another dimension allowing blocks to be stored there remotely. You can also access the blocks and get them back from said dimension with the inventory in build beam mode. Surely there must be some other applications for this technology? This one only works whilst anchored.
A block made out of compressed Rubber for ease of transportation. Produces 120 Rubber bricks when scrapped.
A block made out of compressed Titania for ease of transportation. Produces 42 Titania ingots when scrapped.
Colloquially known as the "Pop Rocket", this air-breathing booster jet can generate thrust of up to 200,000 lbf.

A battlefield grade Anchored Delivery Cannon. This can take some heavy hits and it just keeps on trucking. Like other Delivery Cannons, it is used to blast resource chunks out to orbital relay stations in return for money.
