The "M4" is a continious track tread set built with kevlar bi-weave for strength, flexibility and grip. Unlike steel tread tracks, with links that often need manual repair, this tread has a built-in molten fabric repair unit that top up worn sections of tread whilst in motion.
This Component Dongle can be attached to a Component Factory to allow it to produce Advanced Component Chunks.
A nice streamlined Light. It fits in well with the Streamlined Two Blocks.
A block made out of compressed Luxian for ease of transportation. Produces 120 Luxian crystals when scrapped.
The Venture ZG Hover Pad has a fairly tall lift off the ground, which is great and it can be switched off too, also great.
Use this Better Future Fabricator to craft new Better Future blocks from resource chunks.

The GeoCorp TB Thresher combines a flail/grinder with a collector. It's a great tool for harvesting and collecting resources all in one combined block. The original prototype for this block was developed by Mr T. Bear, although his blueprint was for a much smaller GSO model. GeoCorp saw the potential and took the project on, beefing the unit up significantly and got it to market first.
A left wing. For flying!
The perfect choice for night time adventures and battles. This small but powerful searchlight will auto-lock onto passing enemies.
This switch can control multiple block types on your Tech, allowing them to be turned on or off. This switch can be used for Anti-gravity Engines, Hover Pads, Shield Bubbles, Repair Bubbles.
The Better Future Laser Rifle is a powerful and fast firing laser weapon with no kickback at all. There are very few downsides to this weapon. It's a bit expensive, but worth the price.

An inside corner block to be used with the Edge armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
A straight bumper section with a pad. Part of a set of blocks that can be used to make strong bull bars, bumpers and rams.
A block made out of compressed Rodius for ease of transportation. Produces 120 Rodius capsules when scrapped.
The Pointer Continuous Wave Radar System is a reliable and neat unit to help root out the enemy's position.

A small, modestly priced entry level propeller. Perfect for a budding flight enthusiast's first foray into the open skies. Or useful to bulk up the power and use up any spare space on a larger aircraft.
The Hawkeye Scrapper will take Hawkeye Blocks and break them down into Resource Chunks.

data.block: Better Future Right Medium Hover Flipper
data.description: We're spoiling you, I know. Here we have a Right Medium Hover Flipper to go with your left one. Yeah, this one has vectored thrusting built into the internal hover ring and built-in Adjustment Thrusters to boot. We're too good to you sometimes.
Your bog standard giant Geocorp wheel.
A high power, fast firing Gatling Laser Cannon hidden behind a streamlined panel. You can pack some real firepower without messing up the clean minimalist lines of your Tech.
A very small Fuel Tank with a surprisingly large capacity and price tag.
A block made out of compressed Plumbia for ease of transportation. Produces 64 Plumbia ingots when scrapped.

Small hover pads to reduce friction and keep your Techs floating.

Dr. Daryl Titcomb, a marine electronics engineer, confirmed hydrophobe and self-styled anti-gravity bender, developed the first early prototypes of the technology we now use in hover pads. His initial intention was to develop a mode of transportation over water that would not involve touching it (because it's gross). After a serious injury incurred by trying to use monkfish as a superconductor, Titcomb's arch nemesis - Sir John John Johnson the Third attempted to steal his plans for the hover technology. The dispute over who would lay claim to authorship of the technology was eventually decided by duel. Lucky for Titcomb, his skills learned as an avid historical battle reenactor granted him the upper hand, Sir Johnson was swiftly dispatched and Titcomb reclaimed his legacy.
A cross shaped bumper section with 4 attach points. Part of a set of blocks that can be used to make strong bull bars, bumpers and rams.

data.block: Better Future Medium Skid Landing Gear
data.description: Phwoarrr! Look at this Landing Gear Skid. Isn't it great that it goes up and down on its own? Nice!
A block made out of compressed Rubber for ease of transportation. Produces 24 Rubber bricks when scrapped.

A stronger Shield Bubble Projector than GSO and larger too, but not quite as large or strong as the Hawkeye one. Larger Shield Bubbles take much more power to use and consume more power when repelling attacks.
The 360 Shotgun rotates in all directions. It's less powerful than the Contact Shotgun and has a lower rate of fire. But it will stay on target no matter where the enemy goes.

Developed by a fluidics engineer, Dr. Wren Hensgen. He was originally trying to create a new type of hydraulic trouser press, but got carried away and ended up with a sonic lance capable of launching 50 metric tons of machinery over a house.
This repair bubble is small but heals fast and has a low power drain.
Ideal for manually pushing resources towards the base once they have been harvested.
These are powerful, responsive wings mounted on gimbals so that the whole wing will act as a flap.
This Long Jack Bracket is lighter than a Two Block, but just as durable.

The Air Brake is mainly used for ungrounded Techs (hovercraft, planes, helicopters etc.), It will provide passive braking in a given direction when no input is detected. In other words, it'll slow you down when you stop driving, but only in the direction it is facing.
A silo that can contain up to 40 resource chunks across 4 stacks. It's a mixed silo so can take multiple types of chunks at the same time.

A useful melee weapon to mount around the lower area of your Tech. It will stop anyone from getting too close by burning them with three plasma lances. Get two and flip one over to make a mean set of gnashers.
Small, streamlined, fast firing laser weapon. Low power, but the rate of fire and the compact size make up for it.
This will really let you rain down terror on the enemy.
A left Venture expander wing.

data.block: Better Future Stream Corner One Block
data.description: A nice way to round off the corners of any sections made with the Streamlined One Block.
Very much like a slightly longer version of the normal Venture block.

This Medium Skid acts as a simple, no nonsense landing foot to perch your VTOL craft on whilst grounded. It’s not much use as a wheel, but it will keep the underside of your flying Techs scrape-free when landing.
A good large booster. It's pretty powerful and it will drain your fuel fast too so make sure you bring extra fuel tanks to supply it.

The Big Daddy! Faster and tougher than the GeoCorp Big Boy. It's not got as much torque and can't shift as much weight. But If you're looking for the right wheels for a battle-ready Tech, this is what you need.
A large armour plate. For defence against large threats.
This handy strip light has good coverage and also doubles as a bug zapper too.
Good for sloping sections that are Three Blocks long.
The building blocks of any GeoCorp fleet.
This caterpillar track has a massive carry capacity and excellent offroad grip. It's not very fast though.

A small armoured extender block. Part of the Wrap Armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.

Rudder Tipped Wings have both horizontal and vertical flaps, adding to stability and versatility for minimalist plane designs and enabling grander aircraft an extra free set of tail wing-style vertical rudders.
A block made out of compressed Ignian for ease of transportation. Produces 24 Ignian crystals when scrapped.
A new smaller plough, two units wide.

A large sloping armour plate built at an angle to deflect projectiles. Part of the Spike armour series. Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
This streamlined duck bill shaped block helps to neaten up the lines of your Venture Tech and also trades fewer Attach Points for a bit more armour.

Once powered up, this shield will protect you from enemy attack.

Archaeologist and self-styled Neo Yogi Guru, Joseph Core-Sample was one of the early pioneers of hard light drives, a key component in the creation of Bubble Shield systems. Although Core-Sample has stated that their original purpose was to protect dig sites and trenches from outside tampering or adverse weather. Core-Sample now lives an enigmatic lifestyle in his temple-like home (behind layers of Bubble Shields) where he, "pretends to be normal." Critics claim that he is just a disgruntled old hermit, but he refutes these claims, stating: "I hate it when other people assume or suggest that I am disgruntled. I am always totally gruntled!"
A sleak pilot style cab, perfect for stealth operations.
This Four Block is lighter than four individual One Blocks would be. Use this one instead if you need to fill that space. It's just as tough too.

data.block: Better Future Three Face Blank Block
data.description: This One Block has three blanked out white faces, each with no attach points on them. It's useful for filling in a seamless white finish for your Better Future Tech.
A block made out of compressed Titania for ease of transportation. Produces 120 Titania ingots when scrapped.
This streamlined small dinosaur head shaped block helps to neaten up the lines of your Venture Tech and also trades fewer Attach Points for a bit more armour.
These Block Magnets can be stacked to make super magnets. Handy for lugging all your gear around.

A longer variant of the straight bracket.

Though rather humble at first glance, the introduction of brackets has revolutionised many Tech designers' output. Brackets were first introduced by Professor Ruin, of the Idont Institute in the Western Americadia Republic. Their genius is their simplicity, Ruin saw that if he stripped away all of the unnecessary bulk and weight, a much stronger superstructure could be created that just provided people with raw attach points linked by strong high density metals. Ruin originally devised them for the construction of land train style Techs. Since then, their use has stretched far and wide being favoured particularly by quadcopter fanatics and Venture dirt bike racers. Ruin is recently recovering from an allergic reaction to medication he was taking for his heart condition, he is said to be out of the woods and making a strong recovery.
A rally-style headlight in a rugged casing that will handle the knocks and bumps of the trail with ease.
A large remote charger that will take power from the attached Tech and transfer it to any allied Techs with a battery attached. Long range, slow arc speed and high arc power.
A block made out of compressed Rodius for ease of transportation. Produces 8 Rodius capsules when scrapped.

Much like the propellers offered by other corporations, the Ion Drive requires no power or fuel to function. It works well for helping your ungrounded Techs get off the ground and keep it that way indefinitely. It also has an awesome blue trail.
Chassis Blocks are very light and very strong. Use these to fill up the empty space on the inside of a Tech instead of big heavy One Blocks.
A GeoCorp Terminal, for buying all things GeoCorp, and all things from other corporations too.
This is the business. A large cannon which will fire explosives!
This Venture Fabricator will allow you to craft Venture blocks from resource chunks.

A heavy duty battery pack with a ruggedised casing that can handle more than a few knocks. Much more sturdy than any other battery for its size. This baby ain't cheap, or light, but it stores more than double the capacity of that GSO rubbish and it also comes it this awesome stealth black design. Sure, the LEDs make it a little less stealthy, but yeah.
This Venture Payload Terminal can be used to buy all sorts of Venture blocks.
Did you ever play that game where you have to make neat lines of Blocks in a row and they keep appearing faster and faster? Well the Z-shaped blocks were really helpful in that, right?
Aww, ain't it just the cutest? This little jet is serious business though. Strap a couple of these babies on and you can exit from any hot zone on the double.

data.block: Better Future Stream Extender Two Block
data.description: This extender is great when used with the Wide Streamlined Blocks on their side. You can make a whole new streamlined shape and it looks just as neat as before. Boom!
A rotating anchor that can be planted in the ground. Great for sentry guns.

data.block: Better Future Medium Straight Halo Wheel
data.description: The Medium Halo wheels are fast, responsive and look awesomely futuristic.
A block made out of compressed Erudian for ease of transportation. Produces 120 Erudian crystals when scrapped.
Made from aggregated carbon nanorods with built-in micro channels to disperse force across the surface. This is state of the art when it comes to armour plating.
A silo that can contain up to 90 resource chunks across 9 stacks. It's a mixed silo so can take multiple types of chunks at the same time.

How high are we flying? Don't know? Then this Altimeter is just the thing for you. It tells you how far above sea level it is. What sea? You know, 'the' sea. It's also a slick nose cone shape to go on the front of your plane.

This gyro is excellent for stabilising aircraft that are tricky to fly or for building unstable Techs with two legs or one wheel or whatever. If you have enough of these things, they will hold anything up. This gyro is "active", meaning it will apply torque to force your Tech back to an upright position. And it's also "all axis", meaning it works in all three rotational directions.

***Breaking News*** Molecular biologist, Dr. Chrii Von Vieh of the Germland Institute in Scotmany, noted inventor of the Plasma Cutter & Gyro Rotor, has been sectioned under the mental health act. Dr. Chrii is said to be suffering from delusions and mania. Aides close to the renowned doctor reported receiving severe dressing downs if they failed to address the doctor by "his proper title" - "Lemon Lord, Amber Eminence". The doctor claimed to be a "Royal Advisor" to "The Lemon King". The situation escalated on Tuesday afternoon when during a dispute over lab equipment in the Germland Space Institute, Dr. Chrii attacked a colleague by pinning him down and squeezing a blood orange into his eyes. The Von Vieh family have said that Dr. Chrii has been overworked for months but is now stable and just requires rest. They expect him to make a full recovery in time.

The 'TT12' is a continuous track tread set built with kevlar bi-weave for strength, flexibility and grip. Unlike steel tread tracks, with links that often need manual repair, this tread has a built-in molten fabric repair unit that top up worn sections of tread whilst in motion. The TT12 is a larger more rugged track compared with the medium M4 or the nimble PX.

The "N830RC" is a six-barrel rotary machine gun with a high rate of fire, which can also fire at a high sustained rate. It features a Gatling-style set of rotating barrels with an external power source.

The flame on this thing is blue! BLUE! Do you know how hot blue fire is? No? Neither do I… but it's definitely hotter than that rubbish orange fire. Yeah, once you use blue fire, you're not going to want to mess around with that orange stuff anymore. What's the point?
A block made out of compressed Olastic for ease of transportation. Produces 64 Olastic bricks when scrapped.
An industrial grade, heavy mining plasma cutter tool. This will torch any substance in a matter of seconds.
A simple lighweight bracket with an Attach Point at each end. This is just the thing for keeping the strength up and the weight down.
A block made out of compressed Fibron for ease of transportation. Produces 24 Fibron chunks when scrapped.
This is the big boy. For very large Techs only.

An essential component to be able to assign specific roles for Techs in the fleet.

Jeremy Champion has become a controversial figure in the field of A.I. development and automation. After the Third Singularity War, sanctions were finally put in place to ban the development of sentient synthetics. However, the market demands that a drone be smarter and more helpful than its predecessors and so Champion - Development Manager of Magneto Robotics, has darted back and forth over the line of brilliance and recklessness in his pursuit of a smarter A.I. Some call him a pioneer of the craft, as one of the forefront of creators who are willing to push things forward and others question his policy of testing dangerously autonomous units in the lawless frontiers of off-world mining colonies.

Small pew pew pew laser guns. You'll need a few of them to make an impact.

Professor Yum of the Personal Technology Institute (P-Tech, i-USA), happened upon the Narrow Gauge COIL Laser technology whilst attempting to pioneer a range of ion laser cookery ovens. The idea was to develop a faster method of cooking than conventional microwave ovens. Early tests were plagued with mishaps as the food being heated had a habit of charging with unstable kinetic energy. In one case Yum reportedly threw a piece of bacon at a target after exposure, the bacon turned red in the air and summarily exploded upon impact. The technology has since been repurposed for the defence industry, after a significant reduction in power.
